metadata.name: Azd AKS
metadata.description:
Creates an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster with a system agent pool as well as an additional user agent pool.

**Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed to cater for the requirements of the AZD CLI product. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the development of the AZD CLI but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case.
Optional. The name of the scope map.
Required. The list of scoped permissions for registry artifacts.
Optional. The user friendly description of the scope map.
Optional. The client AAD application ID.
Optional. The server AAD application ID.
Optional. The server AAD application secret.
Required. Specifies whether to enable managed AAD integration.
Required. Specifies whether to enable Azure RBAC for Kubernetes authorization.
Optional. Specifies the AAD group object IDs that will have admin role of the cluster.
Optional. Specifies the tenant ID of the Azure Active Directory used by the AKS cluster for authentication.
Required. The name of the agent pool.
Optional. The availability zones of the agent pool.
Optional. The number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive).
Optional. The source resource ID to create the agent pool from.
Optional. Whether to enable auto-scaling for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable encryption at host for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable FIPS for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable node public IP for the agent pool.
Optional. Whether to enable Ultra SSD for the agent pool.
Optional. The GPU instance profile of the agent pool.

Optional. The minimum number of agents (VMs) to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive).
Optional. The maximum number of pods that can run on a node.
Optional. The minimum number of pods that can run on a node.

Optional. The OS disk type of the agent pool.
Optional. The OS SKU of the agent pool.
Optional. The OS type of the agent pool.
Optional. The pod subnet ID of the agent pool.
Optional. The proximity placement group resource ID of the agent pool.
Optional. The scale down mode of the agent pool.
Optional. The scale set eviction policy of the agent pool.
Optional. The scale set priority of the agent pool.
Optional. The spot max price of the agent pool.

Optional. The type of the agent pool.
Optional. The maximum number of nodes that can be created during an upgrade.

Optional. The VNet subnet ID of the agent pool.
Optional. The workload runtime of the agent pool.

Required. The name of the parent managed cluster. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of your Azure Container Registry.
Required. Name of the Key Vault. Must be globally unique.
Optional. Specifies the location of AKS cluster. It picks up Resource Group's location by default.
Optional. Custom tags to apply to the AKS resources.
Optional. Network plugin used for building the Kubernetes network.
Optional. Specifies the network policy used for building Kubernetes network. - calico or azure.
Optional. Specifies the DNS prefix specified when creating the managed cluster.
Optional. The name of the resource group for the managed resources of the AKS cluster.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Required. Id of the user or app to assign application roles.
Optional. The type of principal to assign application roles.
Optional. Kubernetes Version.
Optional. Tier of a managed cluster SKU.
Optional. Network dataplane used in the Kubernetes cluster. Not compatible with kubenet network plugin.
Optional. Network plugin mode used for building the Kubernetes network. Not compatible with kubenet network plugin.
Optional. Specifies the CIDR notation IP range from which to assign pod IPs when kubenet is used.
Optional. A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign service cluster IPs. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges.
Optional. Specifies the IP address assigned to the Kubernetes DNS service. It must be within the Kubernetes service address range specified in serviceCidr.
Optional. Specifies the SSH RSA public key string for the Linux nodes.
Conditional. Specifies the resource ID of connected application gateway. Required if `ingressApplicationGatewayEnabled` is set to `true`.
Required. Resource ID of the monitoring log analytics workspace.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkRuleSetIpRules are not set.  Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Specifies the sku of the load balancer used by the virtual machine scale sets used by nodepools.
Optional. Scope maps setting.
Optional. Specifies whether the webApplicationRoutingEnabled add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. Tier of your Azure container registry.

Optional. Specifies whether the KeyvaultSecretsProvider add-on is enabled or not.
Optional. If set to true, getting static credentials will be disabled for this cluster. This must only be used on Managed Clusters that are AAD enabled.
Optional. Auto-upgrade channel on the Node Os.
Optional. The System Pool Preset sizing.
Optional. The User Pool Preset sizing.

Optional. Property that controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be ignored. When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. Note that management actions are always authorized with RBAC.
Optional. Provide 'true' to enable Key Vault's purge protection feature.
Optional. Specifies if the vault is enabled for deployment by script or compute.
Optional. Specifies if the vault is enabled for a template deployment.
Optional. Enable RBAC using AAD.
Optional. Enable Azure Active Directory integration.

metadata.name: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster Agent Pools
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Managed Cluster Agent Pool.
Conditional. The name of the parent managed cluster. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the agent pool.
Optional. The list of Availability zones to use for nodes. This can only be specified if the AgentPoolType property is "VirtualMachineScaleSets".

Optional. Desired Number of agents (VMs) specified to host docker containers. Allowed values must be in the range of 0 to 1000 (inclusive) for user pools and in the range of 1 to 1000 (inclusive) for system pools. The default value is 1.
Optional. This is the ARM ID of the source object to be used to create the target object.
Optional. Whether to enable auto-scaler.
Optional. This is only supported on certain VM sizes and in certain Azure regions. For more information, see: /azure/aks/enable-host-encryption. For security reasons, this setting should be enabled.
Optional. See Add a FIPS-enabled node pool (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools#add-a-fips-enabled-node-pool-preview) for more details.

Optional. Some scenarios may require nodes in a node pool to receive their own dedicated public IP addresses. A common scenario is for gaming workloads, where a console needs to make a direct connection to a cloud virtual machine to minimize hops. For more information see upgrading a node pool (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools#upgrade-a-node-pool).
